description: A collection of random observations on the gullibility of (some) journalists.

subs.text: We. Have. Not. Seen. The. Mueller. Report.

Analogy: You’re buying a house, so you hire an inspector. But the seller says I’ll read the inspection report for you, then writes a summary that says the house doesn’t have termites (even though you can see it does) and it might have a leaky roof. Of course you buy the house.
There are two kinds of reporters:
Those who say the Mueller Report says such and such.
Those who say Barr won’t let us read the Mueller Report.
The latter are reporting facts. The former are rewriting a press release.
It seems maybe Trump found a way to fire Mueller after all.
